Sentencas: We report a novel synthesis technique of gadolinia-doped ceria (GDC) nano-rod (NRs) via direct hydrothermal process to enhance performance of low temperature solid oxide fuel cell by increasing active reaction area and ionic conductivity at interface between cathode and electrolyte.
Titulo: Direct hydrothermal growth of GDC nanorods for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The cerium nitrate hexahydrate, gadolinium nitrate hexahydrate and urea were used to synthesis GDC NRs for growth on diverse substrate.
Titulo: Direct hydrothermal growth of GDC nanorods for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The directly grown GDC NRs on substrate had a width from 819 to 490 nm and height about 2200 nm with a varied urea concentration.
Titulo: Direct hydrothermal growth of GDC nanorods for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Under the optimized urea concentration of 40 mMol, we confirmed that GDC NRs able to fully cover the substrate by enlarging active reaction area.
Titulo: Direct hydrothermal growth of GDC nanorods for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: To maximize ionic conductivity of GDC NRs, we synthesis varied GDC NRs with different ratio of gadolinium and cerium precursor.
Titulo: Direct hydrothermal growth of GDC nanorods for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical analysis revealed a significant enhanced performance of fuel cells applying synthesized GDC NRs with a ratio of 2: 8 gadolinium and cerium precursor by reducing polarization resistance, which was chiefly attributed to the enlarged active reaction area and enhanced ionic conductivity of GDC NRs.
Titulo: Direct hydrothermal growth of GDC nanorods for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This method of direct hydrothermal growth of GDC NRs enhancing fuel cell performance was considered to apply other types of catalyzing application using nano-structure such as gas sensing and electrolysis fields.
Titulo: Direct hydrothermal growth of GDC nanorods for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells
Direct hydrothermal growth of GDC nanorods for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells
